org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_mcc

Class ColorCorrectionModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_mcc.ColorCorrectionModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Namespace(value="cv::ccm")
 @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=opencv_mcc.class)
public class ColorCorrectionModel
extends Pointer
    \brief Core class of ccm model

    Produce a ColorCorrectionModel instance for inference

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorCorrectionModel

        public ColorCorrectionModel(Pointer p)
        Pointer cast constructor. Invokes Pointer(Pointer).

      • ColorCorrectionModel

        public ColorCorrectionModel(@Const @ByRef
                            Mat src,
                            @Cast(value="cv::ccm::CONST_COLOR")
                            int constcolor)
        \brief Color Correction Model

        Supported list of color cards: - \ref COLORCHECKER_Macbeth, the Macbeth ColorChecker - \ref COLORCHECKER_Vinyl, the DKK ColorChecker - \ref COLORCHECKER_DigitalSG, the DigitalSG ColorChecker with 140 squares

        Parameters:
        src - detected colors of ColorChecker patches;\n the color type is RGB not BGR, and the color values are in [0, 1];
        constcolor - the Built-in color card

      • ColorCorrectionModel

        public ColorCorrectionModel(@Const @ByRef
                            Mat src,
                            @ByVal
                            Mat colors,
                            @Cast(value="cv::ccm::COLOR_SPACE")
                            int ref_cs)
        \brief Color Correction Model
        Parameters:
        src - detected colors of ColorChecker patches;\n the color type is RGB not BGR, and the color values are in [0, 1];
        colors - the reference color values, the color values are in [0, 1].\n
        ref_cs - the corresponding color space If the color type is some RGB, the format is RGB not BGR;\n

      • ColorCorrectionModel

        public ColorCorrectionModel(@Const @ByRef
                            Mat src,
                            @ByVal
                            Mat colors,
                            @Cast(value="cv::ccm::COLOR_SPACE")
                            int ref_cs,
                            @ByVal
                            Mat colored)
        \brief Color Correction Model
        Parameters:
        src - detected colors of ColorChecker patches;\n the color type is RGB not BGR, and the color values are in [0, 1];
        colors - the reference color values, the color values are in [0, 1].
        ref_cs - the corresponding color space If the color type is some RGB, the format is RGB not BGR;
        colored - mask of colored color

    • Method Detail

      • setColorSpace

        public void setColorSpace(@Cast(value="cv::ccm::COLOR_SPACE")
                          int cs)
        \brief set ColorSpace \note It should be some RGB color space; Supported list of color cards: - \ref COLOR_SPACE_sRGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_AdobeRGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_WideGamutRGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_ProPhotoRGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_DCI_P3_RGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_AppleRGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_REC_709_RGB - \ref COLOR_SPACE_REC_2020_RGB
        Parameters:
        cs - the absolute color space that detected colors convert to;\n default: \ref COLOR_SPACE_sRGB

      • setCCM_TYPE

        public void setCCM_TYPE(@Cast(value="cv::ccm::CCM_TYPE")
                        int ccm_type)
        \brief set ccm_type
        Parameters:
        ccm_type - the shape of color correction matrix(CCM);\n default: \ref CCM_3x3

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(@Cast(value="cv::ccm::DISTANCE_TYPE")
                        int distance)
        \brief set Distance
        Parameters:
        distance - the type of color distance;\n default: \ref DISTANCE_CIE2000

      • setLinear

        public void setLinear(@Cast(value="cv::ccm::LINEAR_TYPE")
                      int linear_type)
        \brief set Linear
        Parameters:
        linear_type - the method of linearization;\n default: \ref LINEARIZATION_GAMMA

      • setLinearGamma

        public void setLinearGamma(double gamma)
        \brief set Gamma

        \note only valid when linear is set to "gamma";\n

        Parameters:
        gamma - the gamma value of gamma correction;\n default: 2.2;

      • setLinearDegree

        public void setLinearDegree(int deg)
        \brief set degree \note only valid when linear is set to - \ref LINEARIZATION_COLORPOLYFIT - \ref LINEARIZATION_GRAYPOLYFIT - \ref LINEARIZATION_COLORLOGPOLYFIT - \ref LINEARIZATION_GRAYLOGPOLYFIT

        Parameters:
        deg - the degree of linearization polynomial;\n default: 3

      • setSaturatedThreshold

        public void setSaturatedThreshold(double lower,
                                  double upper)
        \brief set SaturatedThreshold. The colors in the closed interval [lower, upper] are reserved to participate in the calculation of the loss function and initialization parameters
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower threshold to determine saturation;\n default: 0;
        upper - the upper threshold to determine saturation;\n default: 0

      • setWeightsList

        public void setWeightsList(@Const @ByRef
                           Mat weights_list)
        \brief set WeightsList
        Parameters:
        weights_list - the list of weight of each color;\n default: empty array

      • setWeightCoeff

        public void setWeightCoeff(double weights_coeff)
        \brief set WeightCoeff
        Parameters:
        weights_coeff - the exponent number of L* component of the reference color in CIE Lab color space;\n default: 0

      • setInitialMethod

        public void setInitialMethod(@Cast(value="cv::ccm::INITIAL_METHOD_TYPE")
                             int initial_method_type)
        \brief set InitialMethod
        Parameters:
        initial_method_type - the method of calculating CCM initial value;\n default: INITIAL_METHOD_LEAST_SQUARE

        \brief set MaxCount
        Parameters:
        max_count - used in MinProblemSolver-DownhillSolver;\n Terminal criteria to the algorithm;\n default: 5000;
